segment.source: Convert ink strokes to text using handwriting recognition, or to shapes using custom recognition.
segment.target: Convert ink strokes to text using handwriting recognition, or to shapes using custom recognition.

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Convert ink strokes to text using handwriting recognition, or to shapes using custom recognition.
segment.target: Convert ink strokes to text using handwriting recognition, or to shapes using custom recognition.

segment.source: Handwriting recognition is built in to the Windows ink platform, and supports an extensive set of locales and languages.
segment.target: Handwriting recognition is built in to the Windows ink platform, and supports an extensive set of locales and languages.

segment.source: For all examples here, add the namespace references required for ink functionality.
segment.target: For all examples here, add the namespace references required for ink functionality.

segment.source: Here, we demonstrate how to use the handwriting recognition engine, associated with the default installed language pack, to interpret a set of strokes on an InkCanvas.
segment.target: Here, we demonstrate how to use the handwriting recognition engine, associated with the default installed language pack, to interpret a set of strokes on an InkCanvas.

segment.source: The recognition is initiated by the user clicking a button when they are finished writing.
segment.target: The recognition is initiated by the user clicking a button when they are finished writing.

segment.source: First, we set up the UI.
segment.target: First, we set up the UI.

segment.source: The UI includes a "Recognize" button, the InkCanvas, and an area to display recognition results.
segment.target: The UI includes a "Recognize" button, the InkCanvas, and an area to display recognition results.

segment.source: We then set some basic ink input behaviors.
segment.target: We then set some basic ink input behaviors.

segment.source: The InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes).
segment.target: The InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes).

segment.source: Ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.
segment.target: Ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.

segment.source: A listener for the click event on the "Recognize" button is also declared.
segment.target: A listener for the click event on the "Recognize" button is also declared.

segment.source: Finally, we perform the basic handwriting recognition.
segment.target: Finally, we perform the basic handwriting recognition.

segment.source: For this example, we use the click event handler of the "Recognize" button to perform the handwriting recognition.
segment.target: For this example, we use the click event handler of the "Recognize" button to perform the handwriting recognition.

segment.source: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.
segment.target: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.

segment.source: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.
segment.target: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.

segment.source: A comprehensive subset of languages supported by Windows can be used for handwriting recognition.
segment.target: A comprehensive subset of languages supported by Windows can be used for handwriting recognition.

segment.source: The following table lists the languages supported by the InkRecognizer.
segment.target: The following table lists the languages supported by the InkRecognizer.

segment.source: The first column contains the possible values for Name.
segment.target: The first column contains the possible values for Name.

segment.source: English in the U.S. and the Philippines
segment.target: English in the U.S. and the Philippines

segment.source: English in Great Britain, and all other locations not specified in this table
segment.target: English in Great Britain, and all other locations not specified in this table

segment.source: German in Germany, Austria, Luxembourg, and Namibia
segment.target: German in Germany, Austria, Luxembourg, and Namibia

segment.source: Reconocimiento de escritura a mano en español de Microsoft
segment.target: Reconocimiento de escritura a mano en español de Microsoft

segment.source: Spanish in Spain, and all other locations not specified in this table
segment.target: Spanish in Spain, and all other locations not specified in this table

segment.source: Reconocedor de escritura en Español (México) de Microsoft
segment.target: Reconocedor de escritura en Español (México) de Microsoft

segment.source: Spanish in Mexico and the United States
segment.target: Spanish in Mexico and the United States

segment.source: Reconocedor de escritura en Español (Argentina) de Microsoft
segment.target: Reconocedor de escritura en Español (Argentina) de Microsoft

segment.source: Spanish in Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay
segment.target: Spanish in Argentina, Paraguay, and Uruguay

segment.source: French in France, Canada, Belgium, Switzerland, and all other locations
segment.target: French in France, Canada, Belgium, Switzerland, and all other locations

segment.source: Microsoft 日本語手書き認識エンジン
segment.target: Microsoft 日本語手書き認識エンジン

segment.source: Italian in Italy, Switzerland, and all other locations
segment.target: Italian in Italy, Switzerland, and all other locations

segment.source: Dutch in the Netherlands, Surinam, and the Antilles
segment.target: Dutch in the Netherlands, Surinam, and the Antilles

segment.source: Microsoft 中文(简体)手写识别器
segment.target: Microsoft 中文(简体)手写识别器

segment.source: Microsoft 中文(繁體)手寫辨識器
segment.target: Microsoft 中文(繁體)手寫辨識器

segment.source: Microsoft система распознавания русского рукописного ввода
segment.target: Microsoft система распознавания русского рукописного ввода

segment.source: Reconhecedor de Manuscrito da Microsoft para Português (Brasil)
segment.target: Reconhecedor de Manuscrito da Microsoft para Português (Brasil)

segment.source: Reconhecedor de escrita manual da Microsoft para português
segment.target: Reconhecedor de escrita manual da Microsoft para português

segment.source: Portuguese in Portugal, and all other locations
segment.target: Portuguese in Portugal, and all other locations

segment.source: System rozpoznawania polskiego pisma odręcznego firmy Microsoft
segment.target: System rozpoznawania polskiego pisma odręcznego firmy Microsoft

segment.source: Microsoft rozpoznávač rukopisu pro český jazyk
segment.target: Microsoft rozpoznávač rukopisu pro český jazyk

segment.source: Serbian, in Latin, in all locations
segment.target: Serbian, in Latin, in all locations

segment.source: Serbian, in Cyrillic, in all locations
segment.target: Serbian, in Cyrillic, in all locations

segment.source: Reconeixedor d'escriptura manual en català de Microsoft
segment.target: Reconeixedor d'escriptura manual en català de Microsoft

segment.source: Your app can query the set of installed handwriting recognition engines and use one of those or let a user select their preferred language.
segment.target: Your app can query the set of installed handwriting recognition engines and use one of those or let a user select their preferred language.

segment.source: Users can see a list of installed languages by going to Settings - Time & Language.
segment.target: Users can see a list of installed languages by going to Settings - Time & Language.

segment.source: Installed languages are listed under Languages.
segment.target: Installed languages are listed under Languages.

segment.source: To install new language packs and enable handwriting recognition for that language:
segment.target: To install new language packs and enable handwriting recognition for that language:

segment.source: Go to Settings Time & language Region & language.
segment.target: Go to Settings Time & language Region & language.

segment.source: Select a language from the list, then choose the region version.
segment.target: Select a language from the list, then choose the region version.

segment.source: The language is now listed on the Region & language page.
segment.target: The language is now listed on the Region & language page.

segment.source: Click the language and select Options.
segment.target: Click the language and select Options.

segment.source: On the Language options page, download the Handwriting recognition engine (they can also download the full language pack, speech recognition engine, and keyboard layout here).
segment.target: On the Language options page, download the Handwriting recognition engine (they can also download the full language pack, speech recognition engine, and keyboard layout here).

segment.source: Here, we demonstrate how to use the handwriting recognition engine to interpret a set of strokes on an InkCanvas based on the selected recognizer.
segment.target: Here, we demonstrate how to use the handwriting recognition engine to interpret a set of strokes on an InkCanvas based on the selected recognizer.

segment.source: The recognition is initiated by the user clicking a button when they are finished writing.
segment.target: The recognition is initiated by the user clicking a button when they are finished writing.

segment.source: First, we set up the UI.
segment.target: First, we set up the UI.

segment.source: The UI includes a "Recognize" button, a combo box that lists all installed handwriting recognizers, the InkCanvas, and an area to display recognition results.
segment.target: The UI includes a "Recognize" button, a combo box that lists all installed handwriting recognizers, the InkCanvas, and an area to display recognition results.

segment.source: We then set some basic ink input behaviors.
segment.target: We then set some basic ink input behaviors.

segment.source: The InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes).
segment.target: The InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes).

segment.source: Ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.
segment.target: Ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.

segment.source: We call an function to populate the recognizer combo box with a list of installed handwriting recognizers.
segment.target: We call an function to populate the recognizer combo box with a list of installed handwriting recognizers.

segment.source: We also declare listeners for the click event on the "Recognize" button and the selection changed event on the recognizer combo box.
segment.target: We also declare listeners for the click event on the "Recognize" button and the selection changed event on the recognizer combo box.

segment.source: We populate the recognizer combo box with a list of installed handwriting recognizers.
segment.target: We populate the recognizer combo box with a list of installed handwriting recognizers.

segment.source: An InkRecognizerContainer is created to manage the handwriting recognition process.
segment.target: An InkRecognizerContainer is created to manage the handwriting recognition process.

segment.source: Use this object to call GetRecognizers and retrieve the list of installed recognizers to populate the recognizer combo box.
segment.target: Use this object to call GetRecognizers and retrieve the list of installed recognizers to populate the recognizer combo box.

segment.source: Update the handwriting recognizer if the recognizer combo box selection changes.
segment.target: Update the handwriting recognizer if the recognizer combo box selection changes.

segment.source: Use the InkRecognizerContainer to call SetDefaultRecognizer based on the selected recognizer from the recognizer combo box.
segment.target: Use the InkRecognizerContainer to call SetDefaultRecognizer based on the selected recognizer from the recognizer combo box.

segment.source: Finally, we perform the handwriting recognition based on the selected handwriting recognizer.
segment.target: Finally, we perform the handwriting recognition based on the selected handwriting recognizer.

segment.source: For this example, we use the click event handler of the "Recognize" button to perform the handwriting recognition.
segment.target: For this example, we use the click event handler of the "Recognize" button to perform the handwriting recognition.

segment.source: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.
segment.target: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.

segment.source: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.
segment.target: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.

segment.source: The previous two examples require the user to press a button to start recognition.
segment.target: The previous two examples require the user to press a button to start recognition.

segment.source: Your app can also perform dynamic recognition using stroke input paired with a basic timing function.
segment.target: Your app can also perform dynamic recognition using stroke input paired with a basic timing function.

segment.source: For this example, we'll use the same UI and stroke settings as the previous international recognition example.
segment.target: For this example, we'll use the same UI and stroke settings as the previous international recognition example.

segment.source: Like the previous examples, the InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes), and ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.
segment.target: Like the previous examples, the InkPresenter is configured to interpret input data from both pen and mouse as ink strokes (InputDeviceTypes), and ink strokes are rendered on the InkCanvas using the specified InkDrawingAttributes.

segment.source: Instead of a button to initiate recognition, we add listeners for two InkPresenter stroke events (StrokesCollected and StrokeStarted), and set up a basic timer (DispatcherTimer) with a one second Tick interval.
segment.target: Instead of a button to initiate recognition, we add listeners for two InkPresenter stroke events (StrokesCollected and StrokeStarted), and set up a basic timer (DispatcherTimer) with a one second Tick interval.

segment.source: Here are the handlers for the three events we added in the first step.
segment.target: Here are the handlers for the three events we added in the first step.

segment.source: Start the recognition timer when the user stops inking by lifting their pen or finger, or releasing the mouse button.
segment.target: Start the recognition timer when the user stops inking by lifting their pen or finger, or releasing the mouse button.

segment.source: After one second of no ink input, recognition is initiated.
segment.target: After one second of no ink input, recognition is initiated.

segment.source: If a new stroke starts before the next timer tick event, stop the timer as the new stroke is likely the continuation of a single handwriting entry.
segment.target: If a new stroke starts before the next timer tick event, stop the timer as the new stroke is likely the continuation of a single handwriting entry.

segment.source: Call the recognition function after one second of no ink input.
segment.target: Call the recognition function after one second of no ink input.

segment.source: Finally, we perform the handwriting recognition based on the selected handwriting recognizer.
segment.target: Finally, we perform the handwriting recognition based on the selected handwriting recognizer.

segment.source: For this example, we use the Tick event handler of a DispatcherTimer to initiate the handwriting recognition.
segment.target: For this example, we use the Tick event handler of a DispatcherTimer to initiate the handwriting recognition.

segment.source: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.
segment.target: An InkPresenter stores all ink strokes in an InkStrokeContainer object.

segment.source: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.
segment.target: The strokes are exposed through the StrokeContainer property of the InkPresenter and retrieved using the GetStrokes method.
